nodes.bodyText: This is wrong, it should be as it was before
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -134,7 +134,7 @@ You can declare multiple `<bean>`s if you have more classes.
 Camel will automatic discover and load type converters from all the JARs in the classpath on startup.
 
 Camel will search the classpath for a file called
-`META-INF/services/org/apache/camel/TypeConverterLoader`, which lists
+`META-INF/services/org/apache/camel/TypeConverter`, which lists

nodes.bodyText: You are using the old way (camel 2.x style). In Camel 3.x there is a fast TypeConverterLoader that is recommended to use.

nodes.bodyText:
I fixed the docs. Now with those changes I have working example for Camel 3.x.
I still think documentation is scarce. Would you like to add more details to documentation and probably add working example to Camel examples?

nodes.bodyText: Yeah an example is welcome with a custom type converter. The old way with loader disabled is still possible, but its slower and uses reflection at invoking the converter at runtime. The loader generates source code so its very fast.
